name: unraised
content:
unraised adjective
(LOW/FLAT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
not lifted to a high position: Unraised screens and unbanked seating mean that half the audience can only see the heads of the people in front.
Unraised bread or similar food is flat because it does not contain yeast (= a type of fungus that makes bread rise): A tortilla is a thin, flat, unraised pancake.
More examplesFewer examplesThere are both raised platforms and unraised plaza areas with one or more buildings on the several sides.The children are virtually unable to read textbooks in ordinary unraised print.There were tiny, unraised, round red spots under the skin caused by bleeding. As a child, I picked up bits and pieces about Passover and the Resurrection - the Angel of the Lord and the Lamb of God; unraised bread and Jesus rising again.

unraised adjective
(NOT SAID)
An unraised question or issue has not been mentioned or discussed: Yet the unraised question nags.
More examplesFewer examplesA previously unraised problem exists when a prosecutor gives a witness an opportunity to “straighten out” his testimony.There is the risk that claims and theories unraised in the first litigation may be lost forever. The important unraised question seems to be whether the demographic changes are a direct result of modernization.
